member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Definitions.FormatID
member.summary: Contains a list of Pokémon Showdown battle format IDs supported by the simulator.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Definitions.PokemonID
member.summary:
A Pokémon ID is in the form POSITION: NAME.
This struct separates POSITION into and :
contains the player number.
is if this Pokémon is in the team, but not in battle. Otherwise, refers to the physical location of the Pokémon in and battles.
In singles, this will always be 'a'.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Definitions.PokemonID.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Char},System.String)
member.summary:
A Pokémon ID is in the form POSITION: NAME.
This struct separates POSITION into and :
contains the player number.
is if this Pokémon is in the team, but not in battle. Otherwise, refers to the physical location of the Pokémon in and battles.
In singles, this will always be 'a'.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Definitions.Details
member.summary: A comma-separated list of all information about a Pokémon visible on the battle screen: species, shininess, gender, and level.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Definitions.Details.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: A comma-separated list of all information about a Pokémon visible on the battle screen: species, shininess, gender, and level.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ProtocolElement
member.summary: Provides abstraction over the messages which are output by the Pokémon Showdown simulator protocol.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ProtocolElement.Tags
member.summary: Battle actions (especially minor actions) often come with tags such as [from] EFFECT, [of] SOURCE. EFFECT will be an effect (move, ability, item, status, etc), and SOURCE will be a Pokémon. These can affect the message or animation displayed, but do not affect anything else. Other tags include [still] (suppress animation) and [silent] (suppress message).

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.MinorActionAttribute
member.summary: Decorates any type which is considered a minor action. Minor actions are less important than major actions. Pretty much anything that happens in a battle other than a switch or the fact that a move was used is a minor action. So yes, the effects of a move such as damage or stat boosts are minor actions.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.TimestampElement
member.summary: The current - useful for determining when events occurred in real time.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.TimestampElement.#ctor(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: The current - useful for determining when events occurred in real time.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.TimestampElement.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new given a string representing a UNIX timestamp (the number of seconds since 1970).

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.GameTypeElement
member.summary: is , , , , or .

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.GameTypeElement.#ctor(Showdown.NET.Protocol.GameType)
member.summary: is , , , , or .

list.item: may also be 3 or 4 in 4-player battles.
is the player's avatar identifier (usually a number, but other values can be used for custom avatars.)
is the player's Elo rating in the format they're playing. This will only be displayed in rated battles and when the player is first introduced otherwise it's blank

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.GenElement
member.summary: Generation number, from 1 to 9. Stadium counts as its respective gens; Let's Go counts as 7, and modded formats count as whatever gen they were based on.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.GenElement.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generation number, from 1 to 9. Stadium counts as its respective gens; Let's Go counts as 7, and modded formats count as whatever gen they were based on.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.RatedElement
member.summary:
Will be sent if the game is official in some way.
If is , the game will affect the player's ladder rating (Elo score).
Otherwise, indicates an official game that is not actually rated, such as being a tournament game.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.RatedElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Will be sent if the game is official in some way.
If is , the game will affect the player's ladder rating (Elo score).
Otherwise, indicates an official game that is not actually rated, such as being a tournament game.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.TierElement
member.summary: The name of the format being played. (see also ).

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.TierElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The name of the format being played. (see also ).

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.RuleElement
member.summary: Will appear multiple times, one for each rule.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.RuleElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Will appear multiple times, one for each rule.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ClearPokeElement
member.summary: Marks the start of Team Preview.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.PokeElement
member.summary:
Declares a Pokémon for Team Preview.
is the player ID (see ).
describes the Pokémon (see ).
will be item if the Pokémon is holding an item, or blank if it isn't.
Note that forme and shininess are hidden on this, unlike on the details message.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.PokeElement.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Declares a Pokémon for Team Preview.
is the player ID (see ).
describes the Pokémon (see ).
will be item if the Pokémon is holding an item, or blank if it isn't.
Note that forme and shininess are hidden on this, unlike on the details message.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.TeamPreviewElement
member.summary: These messages appear if you're playing a format that uses team previews.

list.item: is the number of Pokémon your opponent starts with. In games without Team Preview, you don't know which Pokémon your opponent has, but you at least know how many there are.
is the number of Pokémon your opponent starts with. In games without Team Preview, you don't know which Pokémon your opponent has, but you at least know how many there are.

member.summary: has won the battle.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.TieElement
member.summary: The battle has ended in a tie.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.InactiveElement
member.summary: A message related to the battle timer has been sent. The official client displays these messages in red. means that the timer is on at the time the message was sent, while means that the timer is off.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.InactiveElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: A message related to the battle timer has been sent. The official client displays these messages in red. means that the timer is on at the time the message was sent, while means that the timer is off.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.MoveElement
member.summary:
The specified has used move at . If a move has multiple targets or no target, should be ignored. If a move targets a side, will be a (possibly fainted) Pokémon on that side.
contains secondary information.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.MoveElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,Showdown.NET.Protocol.MoveDetails)
member.summary:
The specified has used move at . If a move has multiple targets or no target, should be ignored. If a move targets a side, will be a (possibly fainted) Pokémon on that side.
contains secondary information.

member.summary: Contains secondary information about a move that was used in a battle.

member.name: F:Showdown.NET.Protocol.MoveDetails.Miss
member.summary: If , the move missed.

member.name: F:Showdown.NET.Protocol.MoveDetails.Still
member.summary: If , no animation should play.

member.name: F:Showdown.NET.Protocol.MoveDetails.Animation
member.summary: If not , contains the name of the move whose animation should be used instead of the move that was actually used.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.SwitchElement

summary.para: A Pokémon identified by has switched in (if there was an old Pokémon in that position, it is switched out).

and represent all the information that can be used to tell Pokémon apart. If two Pokémon have the same and (which will never happen in any format with Species Clause), you usually won't be able to tell if the same Pokémon switched in or a different Pokémon switched in.

The switched Pokémon has HP , and status . is specified as a fraction; if it is your own Pokémon then it will be CURRENT/MAX, if not, it will be /100 if HP Percentage Mod is in effect and /48 otherwise. can be left , or it can be , , etc.

member.remarks: A indicates an intentional switch, in contrast with , which indicates it was unintentional (forced by Whirlwind, Roar, etc).

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.SwitchElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,Showdown.NET.Definitions.StatusID)

summary.para: A Pokémon identified by has switched in (if there was an old Pokémon in that position, it is switched out).

and represent all the information that can be used to tell Pokémon apart. If two Pokémon have the same and (which will never happen in any format with Species Clause), you usually won't be able to tell if the same Pokémon switched in or a different Pokémon switched in.

The switched Pokémon has HP , and status . is specified as a fraction; if it is your own Pokémon then it will be CURRENT/MAX, if not, it will be /100 if HP Percentage Mod is in effect and /48 otherwise. can be left , or it can be , , etc.

member.remarks: A indicates an intentional switch, in contrast with , which indicates it was unintentional (forced by Whirlwind, Roar, etc).

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.DetailsChangeElement
member.summary:
The specified Pokémon has changed formes (via Mega Evolution, ability, etc.) to SPECIES (provided in for , provided directly for .) If the forme change is permanent (Mega Evolution or a Shaymin-Sky that is frozen), then will appear; otherwise, the client will send .
Syntax is the same as .

member.summary:
The specified Pokémon has changed formes (via Mega Evolution, ability, etc.) to SPECIES (provided in for , provided directly for .) If the forme change is permanent (Mega Evolution or a Shaymin-Sky that is frozen), then will appear; otherwise, the client will send .
Syntax is the same as .

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ReplaceElement
member.summary:
Illusion has ended for the specified Pokémon. Syntax is the same as , but remember that everything you thought you knew about the previous Pokémon is now wrong.
will be the NEW Pokémon ID - i.e. it will have the nickname of the Zoroark (or other Illusion user).

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ReplaceElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,Showdown.NET.Definitions.StatusID)
member.summary:
Illusion has ended for the specified Pokémon. Syntax is the same as , but remember that everything you thought you knew about the previous Pokémon is now wrong.
will be the NEW Pokémon ID - i.e. it will have the nickname of the Zoroark (or other Illusion user).

member.summary: Moves already active to active field where the leftmost position is 0 and each position to the right counts up by 1.

member.summary: Moves already active to active field where the leftmost position is 0 and each position to the right counts up by 1.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.FailElement
member.summary: The specified has failed against the targeted. The in question should be a move that fails due to its own mechanics. Moves (or effect activations) that fail because they're blocked by another effect should use -block instead.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.FailElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The specified has failed against the targeted. The in question should be a move that fails due to its own mechanics. Moves (or effect activations) that fail because they're blocked by another effect should use -block instead.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.BlockElement
member.summary: An effect targeted at was blocked by . This may optionally specify that the effect was a from . [of]SOURCE will note the owner of the , in the case that it's not (for instance, an ally with Aroma Veil.)

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.BlockElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: An effect targeted at was blocked by . This may optionally specify that the effect was a from . [of]SOURCE will note the owner of the , in the case that it's not (for instance, an ally with Aroma Veil.)

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.NoTargetElement
member.summary: A move has failed due to their being no target Pokémon . is in Generation 1. This action is specific to Generations 1-4 as in later Generations a failed move will display using .

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.NoTargetElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: A move has failed due to their being no target Pokémon . is in Generation 1. This action is specific to Generations 1-4 as in later Generations a failed move will display using .

summary.para: The specified Pokémon has taken damage, and is now at (see for details).
If is 0, should be ignored. The current behavior is for to be fnt, but this may change and should not be relied upon.

member.summary: Invert the boosts of the target Pokémon . (For example: Topsy-Turvy).

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.InvertBoostElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Invert the boosts of the target Pokémon . (For example: Topsy-Turvy).

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ClearBoostElement
member.summary: Clears all of the boosts of the target . (For example: Clear Smog).

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ClearBoostElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Clears all of the boosts of the target . (For example: Clear Smog).

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ClearAllBoostElement
member.summary: Clears all boosts from all Pokémon on both sides. (For example: Haze).

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ClearPositiveBoostElement
member.summary: Clear the positive boosts from the Pokémon due to an EFFECT of the Pokémon. (For example: 'move: Spectral Thief').

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ClearPositiveBoostElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Clear the positive boosts from the Pokémon due to an EFFECT of the Pokémon. (For example: 'move: Spectral Thief').

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ClearNegativeBoostElement
member.summary: Clear the negative boosts from the target Pokémon . (For example: usually as the result of a [zeffect]).

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ClearNegativeBoostElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Clear the negative boosts from the target Pokémon . (For example: usually as the result of a [zeffect]).

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.CopyBoostElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copy the boosts from Pokémon to Pokémon (For example: Psych Up).

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.WeatherElement
member.summary: Indicates the weather that is currently in effect. If is , it means that was active previously and is still in effect that turn. Otherwise, it means that the weather has changed due to a move or ability, or has expired, in which case will be .

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.WeatherElement.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ItemElement
member.summary: The held by the has been changed or revealed. If this includes a [from]EFFECT tag, it is due to a move or ability EFFECT. Otherwise, it's because the Pokémon has just switched in, and its item is being announced to have a long-term effect.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ItemElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The held by the has been changed or revealed. If this includes a [from]EFFECT tag, it is due to a move or ability EFFECT. Otherwise, it's because the Pokémon has just switched in, and its item is being announced to have a long-term effect.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.EndItemElement
member.summary:
The held by has been destroyed, and it now holds no item. If this includes a [from]EFFECT tag, it is due to a move or ability (like Knock Off). Otherwise, it is because the item has destroyed itself (consumed Berries, Air Balloon). If a berry is consumed, the [eat] tag will be included.
This will be silent [silent] if the item's ownership was changed (with a move or ability like Thief or Trick), even if the move or ability would result in a Pokémon without an item.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.EndItemElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
The held by has been destroyed, and it now holds no item. If this includes a [from]EFFECT tag, it is due to a move or ability (like Knock Off). Otherwise, it is because the item has destroyed itself (consumed Berries, Air Balloon). If a berry is consumed, the [eat] tag will be included.
This will be silent [silent] if the item's ownership was changed (with a move or ability like Thief or Trick), even if the move or ability would result in a Pokémon without an item.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.AbilityElement
member.summary: The of the has been changed or revealed. If this includes a [from]EFFECT tag, it is due to a move or ability EFFECT. Otherwise, it's because the Pokémon has just switched in, and its ability is being announced to have a long-term effect.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.AbilityElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The of the has been changed or revealed. If this includes a [from]EFFECT tag, it is due to a move or ability EFFECT. Otherwise, it's because the Pokémon has just switched in, and its ability is being announced to have a long-term effect.

summary.para: A miscellaneous effect has activated. This is triggered whenever an effect could not be better described by one of the other minor messages: for example, healing abilities like Water Absorb simply use -heal.

Items usually activate with -end, although items with two messages, like Berries ("POKÉMON ate the Leppa Berry! POKÉMON restored PP...!"), will send the "ate" message as -eat, and the "restored" message as -activate.

A miscellaneous effect has activated. This is triggered whenever an effect could not be better described by one of the other minor messages: for example, healing abilities like Water Absorb simply use -heal.

Items usually activate with -end, although items with two messages, like Berries ("POKÉMON ate the Leppa Berry! POKÉMON restored PP...!"), will send the "ate" message as -eat, and the "restored" message as -activate.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.HintElement
member.summary: Displays a message in parentheses to the client. Hint messages appear to explain and clarify why certain actions, such as Fake Out and Mat Block failing, have occurred, when there would normally be no in-game messages.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.HintElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Displays a message in parentheses to the client. Hint messages appear to explain and clarify why certain actions, such as Fake Out and Mat Block failing, have occurred, when there would normally be no in-game messages.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.CenterElement
member.summary: Appears in Triple Battles when only one Pokémon remains on each side, to indicate that the Pokémon have been automatically centered.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.MessageElement
member.summary: Displays a miscellaneous message to the client. These messages are primarily used for messages from game mods that aren't supported by the client, like rule clauses such as Sleep Clause, or other metagames with custom messages for specific scenarios.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.MessageElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Displays a miscellaneous message to the client. These messages are primarily used for messages from game mods that aren't supported by the client, like rule clauses such as Sleep Clause, or other metagames with custom messages for specific scenarios.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.CombineElement
member.summary: A move has been combined with another. (For example: Fire Pledge)

member.summary: The Pokémon has used a move and is waiting for the Pokémon (For example: Fire Pledge).

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.WaitingElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The Pokémon has used a move and is waiting for the Pokémon (For example: Fire Pledge).

member.summary:
The Pokémon is preparing to use a charge on the . (For example: Sky Drop).
If is , the target is unknown. (For example: Dig, Fly).

Gives a JSON object containing a request for a choice (to move or switch). See

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ISplitElement
member.summary:
Exposes the members of non-generically. Handy for easier mass parsing of unknown elements.
should always be used for internal parsing.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.SplitElement`1
member.summary:
Contains two s of the same type:
is a message for the specific player or an omniscient observer (details which may contain information about exact details of the player's set, like exact HP).
is a message with public details suitable for display to opponents / teammates / spectators. Note that this may be empty.
These can be exposed non-generically by casting the to .

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.SplitElement`1.#ctor(System.Int32,`0,`0)
member.summary:
Contains two s of the same type:
is a message for the specific player or an omniscient observer (details which may contain information about exact details of the player's set, like exact HP).
is a message with public details suitable for display to opponents / teammates / spectators. Note that this may be empty.
These can be exposed non-generically by casting the to .

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.SpacerElement
member.summary: Clears the message-bar, and add a spacer to the battle history. This is usually done automatically by detecting the message-type, but can also be forced to happen with this.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.DebugElement
member.summary: A debug message.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.DebugElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: A debug message.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ErrorElement
member.summary:
Signals that a decision was sent which is somehow invalid:
If is , an invalid decision was sent (trying to switch when you're trapped by Mean Look or something).
If is , your previous choice revealed additional information (For example: a move disabled by Imprison or a trapping effect), and a will be sent to follow up on.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ErrorElement.#ctor(Showdown.NET.Protocol.ErrorType,System.String)
member.summary:
Signals that a decision was sent which is somehow invalid:
If is , an invalid decision was sent (trying to switch when you're trapped by Mean Look or something).
If is , your previous choice revealed additional information (For example: a move disabled by Imprison or a trapping effect), and a will be sent to follow up on.

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.ErrorType
member.summary: The type of error output by the Pokémon Showdown simulator, obtained in .

member.name: T:Showdown.NET.Protocol.UnknownElement
member.summary: does not support this message type yet, so it is received as an unknown element.

member.name: M:Showdown.NET.Protocol.UnknownElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: does not support this message type yet, so it is received as an unknown element.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.Name
member.summary: Nickname. Should be identical to its base species if not specified by the player, e.g. "Minior".

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.Species
member.summary: Species name (including forme if applicable), e.g. "Minior-Red". This should always be converted to an id before use.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.Item
member.summary: This can be an id, e.g. "whiteherb" or a full name, e.g. "White Herb". This should always be converted to an id before use.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.Ability
member.summary: This can be an id, e.g. "shieldsdown" or a full name, e.g. "Shields Down". This should always be converted to an id before use.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.Moves
member.summary: Each move can be an id, e.g. "shellsmash" or a full name, e.g. "Shell Smash" These should always be converted to ids before use.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.Nature
member.summary: This can be an id, e.g. "adamant" or a full name, e.g. "Adamant". This should always be converted to an id before use.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.EVs
member.summary:
Effort Values, used in stat calculation. These must be between 0 and 255, inclusive.
Also used to store AVs for Let's Go

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.IVs
member.summary:
Individual Values, used in stat calculation. These must be between 0 and 31, inclusive.
These are also used as DVs, or determinant values, in Gens 1 and 2, which are represented as even numbers from 0 to 30.
In Gen 2-6, these must match the Hidden Power type.
In Gen 7+, Bottle Caps means these can either match the Hidden Power type or 31.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.Level
member.summary: This is usually between 1 and 100, inclusive, but the simulator supports levels up to 9999 for testing purposes.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.Shiny
member.summary: While having no direct competitive effect, certain Pokemon cannot be legally obtained as shiny, either as a whole or with certain event-only abilities or moves.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.Happiness
member.summary:
This is technically "Friendship", but the community calls this "Happiness".
It's used to calculate the power of the moves Return and Frustration. This value must be between 0 and 255, inclusive.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.Pokeball
member.summary:
The pokeball this Pokemon is in. Like shininess, this property has no direct competitive effects, but has implications for event legality. For example, any Rayquaza that knows V-Create must be sent out from a Cherish Ball.
TODO: actually support this in the validator, switching animations, and the teambuilder.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.HpType
member.summary: Hidden Power type. Optional in older gens, but used in Gen 7+ because `ivs` contain post-Battle-Cap values.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.DynamaxLevel
member.summary: Dynamax Level. Affects the amount of HP gained when Dynamaxed. This value must be between 0 and 10, inclusive.

member.name: P:Showdown.NET.Simulator.PokemonSet.TeraType
member.summary: Tera Type
